intro: Astragalus kuhitangi, commonly known as the Kuhitanga milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Astragalus kuhitangi is known for its medicinal properties and has been used by Māori for traditional healing purposes. Its conservation status is of concern due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
